segment.source: How to Load Files and Packages
segment.target: How to Load Files and Packages

segment.source: How to Load Files and Packages
segment.target: How to Load Files and Packages

segment.source: How to Load Files and Packages
segment.target: How to Load Files and Packages

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to load files and packages on Application Virtualization Servers.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to load files and packages on Application Virtualization Servers.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: During the installation process, you specified the location of the Content directory on the Content Path page.
segment.target: During the installation process, you specified the location of the Content directory on the Content Path page.

segment.source: This directory should be created and configured as a standard file share before you point to its location.
segment.target: This directory should be created and configured as a standard file share before you point to its location.

segment.source: To load files and packages
segment.target: To load files and packages

segment.source: On the computer from which you will stream applications, navigate to the location that you specified for the Content directory.
segment.target: On the computer from which you will stream applications, navigate to the location that you specified for the Content directory.

segment.source: If necessary, create the directory and configure it as a standard file share.
segment.target: If necessary, create the directory and configure it as a standard file share.

segment.source: Move the SFT files for the virtual applications and packages to the Content directory.
segment.target: Move the SFT files for the virtual applications and packages to the Content directory.

segment.source: To keep the SFT files organized and to avoid confusion, put applications and packages in dedicated subfolders.
segment.target: To keep the SFT files organized and to avoid confusion, put applications and packages in dedicated subfolders.

segment.source: Load the applications and packages according to the requirements of your scenario and configuration, considering the following conditions:
segment.target: Load the applications and packages according to the requirements of your scenario and configuration, considering the following conditions:

segment.source: If your applications and packages are stored on an Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Server, load them through the Management Console.
segment.target: If your applications and packages are stored on an Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Server, load them through the Management Console.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Load or Unload an Application or How to Load Virtual Applications from the Desktop Notification Area.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Load or Unload an Application or How to Load Virtual Applications from the Desktop Notification Area.

segment.source: If your applications are stored on an App-V Streaming Server, a Web server, or a computer configured as a file server, the applications can be automatically loaded.
segment.target: If your applications are stored on an App-V Streaming Server, a Web server, or a computer configured as a file server, the applications can be automatically loaded.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The App-V Streaming Server automatically polls the Content directory for applications and packages and puts this information in RAM to service application requests.
segment.target: The App-V Streaming Server automatically polls the Content directory for applications and packages and puts this information in RAM to service application requests.

segment.source: The App-V Clients must be properly configured to retrieve applications and packages from Web servers and file servers.
segment.target: The App-V Clients must be properly configured to retrieve applications and packages from Web servers and file servers.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Configure the Client for Application Package Retrieval.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Configure the Client for Application Package Retrieval.

segment.target: Related topics
